title: Is nottingham Ezreal part of the Rift Quest universe now?
body:
Like is it his DnD skin now?

Kind of like Bard Bard and the others?

Because he says his character will be Jarro Lightfeather, handsome rogue paladin Elf.
And Nottingham is a handsome elf with roguish gear that uses light(read, paladin) magic.

...Can there be more skins like this?
(Sorry for the shipping but... actually no I'm not...)
Can Sorceress Lux be put into that line?
:3

replies.body:
Speaking as a former resident of Nottingham... this skin confuses me...

{{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}}

> [{quoted}](name=Scathlocke,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=3PxwAOKz,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2018-10-04T21:29:46.314+0000)
>
> Speaking as a former resident of Nottingham... this skin confuses me...
> 
> {{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}}

The name is just a thin veil for "Robin Hood Ezreal". That should explain it.

WHY HE HAVE POINTY EARS??

The only elves I knew in Nottingham were the ones at Games Workshop HQ... :-P

> [{quoted}](name=Scathlocke,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=3PxwAOKz,comment-id=000200040000,timestamp=2018-10-05T01:44:14.812+0000)The only elves I knew in Nottingham were the ones at Games Workshop HQ... :-P

In fairness, it's entirely possible that Nottingham was FULL of elves, and you just never MET any.
Nah, he's just going to the wrong bars.
No, you find Faeries at bars, elves are more sophisticated, you find them at clubs.

> [{quoted}](name=Scathlocke,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=3PxwAOKz,comment-id=000200040000,timestamp=2018-10-05T01:44:14.812+0000)
>
> WHY HE HAVE POINTY EARS??
> 
> The only elves I knew in Nottingham were the ones at Games Workshop HQ... :-P

Because...medieval fairy tale stuff.

But Robin Hood isn’t a fairy tale, per se. There’s no magic or faeries like there is in, say, Arthurian lore. 

Robin Hood’s just a folk hero. And, Robin Hood’s not even from Nottingham. It’s a weird skin, man.

> [{quoted}](name=Scathlocke,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=3PxwAOKz,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2018-10-04T21:29:46.314+0000)
>
> Speaking as a former resident of Nottingham... this skin confuses me...
> 
> {{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}}

honestly at this point just rename Nottingham to Ezreal Lightfeather :^)

> [{quoted}](name=Scathlocke,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=3PxwAOKz,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2018-10-04T21:29:46.314+0000)
>
> Speaking as a former resident of Nottingham... this skin confuses me...
> 
> {{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}}

While on the subject, I was told to ask you about Jarro Lightfeather. The name pops up repeatedly in Ezreal's new VO, across multiple skins, and even in his base, and all of them are different in terms of what they are (Classic seems to use it as a pseudonym, Nottingham uses it as a DnD name, and Pulsefire asks RiftQuest skins if he can be Jarro Lightfeather in their game, etc). So what exactly is this name all about? There's no lore at all about why he's using this name and what it's relevance is.

Actually there is.

Jarro Lightfeather.

Jar of Lightfeather Pomade, his favorite brand, it's a giant pun.

> [{quoted}](name=Scathlocke,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=3PxwAOKz,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2018-10-04T21:29:46.314+0000)
>
> Speaking as a former resident of Nottingham... this skin confuses me...
> 
> {{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}}

Maybe YOU are part of the Rift Quest universe now
Prolly but after the Infernal Akali debacle riot knows better than to trigger the community
